page.title: 08A Killamarsh Miner
page.content: We walked there with our teacher and talked to the Miner in his home. He told us that in his spare time he likes watching football, gardening and swimming. He goes swimming in Eckington Baths. He has lived in Killamarsh for nine and a half years. He enjoys working down the Pit but doesn't enjoy Night Shift. His job is a Supervisor. When the strike was on he didn't like it because the other men wanted him to go on strike but his Union weren't on strike so he couldn't He had nothing to do when he was on strike but he still got paid. He told us that in the pit they hold the roof up with steel girders and sometimes just ordinary timber. High Moor Pit, where he works, has Trackless Vehicles which run along the Galleries carrying materials to the Coal Face. The coal is removed from the pit on conveyors.
